summary.Title: Discipline Engineers E&I and Mechanical offshore
summary.JobHeadline: Discipline Engineers E&I and Mechanical offshore
summary.Presentation: At Semco Maritime we are looking for experienced employees with electrical & instrumentation and mechanical construction backgrounds to join us, as offshore Discipline Engineers.&nbs

JobPositionInformation.PositionTitle: Discipline Engineers E&I and Mechanical offshore
JobPositionInformation.Purpose:
At Semco Maritime we are looking for experienced employees with electrical & instrumentation and mechanical construction backgrounds to join us, as offshore Discipline Engineers.
 
Your position 
You will have a challenging job in an international and ever-changing environment. You will be an important part of the offshore team that manages the offshore scope of work.

The offshore execution phase is currently going on in the Danish North Sea and the scope of work is a combination of maintenance and modification tasks.

The duration of the contract is estimated to be 4-months. 
 
Your tasks & responsibilities 
As our new discipline engineer you will work to ensure that the installations of mechanical or electrical discipline activities are carried out according to the quality standards and the scope of work.
 
Your tasks will include but are not limited to:

  • Being responsible for the correct as-build and final handover to QC and 3rd party verification
  • Ensuring clear interfaces towards suppliers and subcontractors with respect to scope of work, system design and area design 
  • Ensuring qualified discipline participation within Quality Surveillance and follow-up of suppliers and sub-contractors 
  • Assisting in material & work scope overview & execution according to execution schedule
  • Being a focal point between CDTL and respective discipline foremen

Your profile & qualifications 
As a person you are reliable and trustworthy, you enjoy keeping the overview of the given tasks and following up on work.
 
To succeed in this position, we expect that you have the following qualifications:

  • Engineering degree (MSc/BSc), or equivalent technical discipline qualification within instrument, electrical or mechanical may be considered
  • Experience from a similar role as a discipline engineer within electrical, process, instrument/control from offshore project commissioning
  • Good communication skills in written and verbal English
  • EDP user knowledge in SAP and Pims

Welcome to Semco Maritime 
We offer you an interesting and challenging job in an international company, where we strive to provide innovative and sustainable solutions globally. You will get the unique opportunity to work in an environment characterized by dedication, passion and ambition. 
 
We conduct our interviews on an ongoing basis, so if you are interested, you must submit your application as soon as possible via the link on the page. 
If you have any questions, you are welcome to contact Anna Dam on anna@semcomaritime.com.   
 
We look forward to hearing from you!
